stanza.line: My mistress' eyes are nothing like the (a)sun(/a)
Coral is far more red than her lips (b)red(/b)
If snow be white why then her breasts are (a)dun(/a)
If hairs be wires black wires grow on her (b)head(/b)
I have seen roses damasked red and (c)white(/c)
But no such roses see I in her (d)cheeks(/d)
And in some perfumes is there more (c)delight(/c)
Than in the breath that from my mistress (d)reeks(/d)
I love to hear her speak yet well I (e)know(/e)
That music hath a far more pleasing (f)sound(/f)
I grant I never saw a goddess (e)go(/e)
My mistress when she walks treads on the (f)ground(/f)
And yet by heaven I think my love as (g)rare(/g)
As any she belied with false (g)compare(/g)
